text: I'm trying to remove the date/time stamps on this page but not finding the code in the stylesheet. Is there somewhere else I should be looking <https://www.switchfly.com/newsroom/press-releases>
maybe I just overlooked where it is
are you just looking to hide it with CSS, or remove the markup for the date/time?
remove the markup
look in the listing markup for `<div class="date-module">`
and delete that sucker
and set a 100% width on that banner image
Dennis beat me to it.  If you delete that div, you should be good.
:bowtie:
You guys are such rock stars. Thank you!
so, it's just moving the dates over and making them bigger, rather than deleting them altogether. did i miss something in the code?
mind posting your code?
I got rid of the whole date module as you said (just included it here so you could see in entirety)
so now it looks like this:
ok, so I think there’s a little bit of confusion here.  What you have here are CSS stylesheets.  What we were suggesting was to go into the blog template file and edit the HTML in there.
When you are on the page, you should see a little HubSpot gear icon at the top right of the page, click on that and in  the drop down select `Edit Blog Template`

Once you are in the blog template, search for `<div class="date-module"></div>` And delete that whole div with everything inside it.  ( it will have some hubl in there for the date and times.  something that looks like `{{ year }}`)
oh got it. sorry for the mix up. thank you!
yup!
